Error trying to run a 'program' with the extension
data.body:
When I run the extension from Visual Code and I try to start a 'program' I get:
Error: DebugAdapter bin folder not found on path c:/.../vscode-mock-debug-master/out/mockDebug.js

It doesn't generate the output file. I checked HelloWorld extension and it compiled correctly. I also tried installing Mock-Debug as pre-built extension and it works too.

Regards

data.title: March Iteration Plan
data.body:
# Update to 1.0 Release of VS Code

We have now completed engineering work for our “1.0” release of VS Code. However, with all of the excitement around [//Build](https://build.microsoft.com/), we've decided to take this opportunity to hold back our "1.0" release for just a couple of weeks, to get some more community testing on the product. Our “Insiders” release has been updated to match what we plan to ship in mid April. We encourage you to [download it today](http://code.visualstudio.com/insiders?wt.mc_id=DX_835018&utm_source=blogs&utm_medium=ms%20editorial&utm_campaign=GH%20Roadmap%201-0%20Update) ([release notes](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-docs/blob/vnext/release-notes/latest.md)), use it, and let us know if you find any critical ship stopping issues. In the meantime we're going to finish up work on the [1.0 documentation](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-docs/tree/vnext/docs), clean up debt, unwind a bit, and start planning the future of Visual Studio Code.

---

March is our end game for the [Build 2016](http://build.microsoft.com/) milestone. During the endgame the focus is on problems, performance, publish. This doesn't mean that we do stop listening to feedback, but we will slow down on adding new features.
## [Endgame](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/Development-Process#end-game) Schedule
##### Monday, Mar 14
- [x] Code freeze early morning
- [x] Test build done
- [x] Testing
##### Tuesday
- [x] Test tours
- [x] Fixing
- [x] Run OSS tool @joaomoreno  
##### Wednesday
- [x] Test tours
- [x] Fixing
##### Thursday
- [x] Fixing
- [x] Test [Tours](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3Atestplan-item+tour)
- [x] Verification
##### Friday
- [x] Memory leak investigation and fixing
- [x] nls input @dbaeumer 
- [x] Verification
##### Monday, Mar 21
- [x] Smoketest
  - [x] Windows 
  - [x] OS X 
  - [x] Linux 
- [x] Release [`insider`](https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/vscode/2016/02/01/introducing-insiders-builds/) channel
- [x] All release notes updated 
##### Tuesday-Friday
- [x] All issues verified
- Satellite modules ready, version updated, smoke tested
  - [x] vscode @bpasero 
  - [x] yo generator @aeschli 
  - [x] vsce @joaomoreno: 
  - [x] Debug adapter @weinand 
  - [x] Language client/server @dbaeumer 
  - [x] eslint (recommended linter for JS) @dbaeumer 
- [x] doc(review)athon Microsoft/vscode-docs#244

For more information about our development process please refer to the development process [page](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/Development-Process).
#### Finish
- UI
  - [x] Folding - add commands to fold to a particular level @aeschli 
    - Test #4069
    - [x] Release notes
  - Explore - HTML Preview run from a WebView and support executing JS #2912 @bpasero, @jrieken 
    - [x] WebView is the way to go, but we have to defer this to after March. For March we will support to run scripts inside the iframe, this addresses #2912.
    - [x] Release notes
  - [x] Support to associate an extension with a language/mode @bpasero @aeschli 
    - Test: #3925
    - [x] Release notes
  - [x] Column Select #1515 @alexandrudima 
    - Mouse select is done, need to also support using the keyboard, the preferred key binding is already 
      taken.
  - Test: #4092
  - [x] Release notes
- Install
  - [x] Support redhat install, provide RPM package #3603, #3595 @tyriar
    - Test: #4041
    - [x] Release notes
  - [x] Support install localized version of Code+bundled extensions @dbaeumer 
    - Test: #4018 
    - [x] Release notes
- Extensions
  - [x] Inform user when an update to an extension is available #3540 @joaomoreno 
    - Show a status bar contribution with the number of out dated extensions
  - [x] Show progress when installing an extension #2835 @joaomoreno 
    - Show a status bar contribution `installing extensions`
  - Test: #4024
-  JS  
  - [x] Add support to disable Salsa syntax errors `javascript.validate.enable` #3909 @dbaeumer 
  - [x] Guide users to configure a `jsconfig.json` file @jrieken 
    - Test: #4007 
    - [x] Release notes
  - [x] Guide users configure excludes for a large project @jrieken
    - Test: #4007 
    - [x] Release notes
- Debug
  - [x] Support to run a target without the debugger Microsoft/vscode#2780 @weinand
    - Test: #3906
    - [x] Release notes
  - [x] Integrate node-debug in nls tooling Microsoft/vscode#3578 @weinand, @dbaeumer 
  - [x] Support to pass a 'More Information' url from the debug adapter to the frontend 
    - Test: #4026
      Microsoft/vscode#3448 @weinand
- Accessibility
  - [x] Reader cannot access IntelliSense dropdown contents Microsoft/vscode#3640 @alexandrudima  
    - Test: #4093
    - [x] Release notes
- Editor
  - [x] Investigate into how we can help improve VIM extensions by providing additional API @alexandrudima  
    - [x] Release notes
  - [x] Add support so that Code can be used as the git editor @bpasero 
    - Test #3954
    - [x] Release notes
- Localization
  - Support a setting for the locale @dbaeumer 
    - [x] Release notes
#### Problems.Performance
- [x] High Energy Impact. #774, #3222 @bpasero
- [x] Code Folding in larger files add a limit for the number of folded regions #3582 @aeschli
- [x] Debt - Do not use Remote in event handlers #3072
#### Polish
- Language support
  - [x] Revisit intellisense inside comments Microsoft/vscode-go#203 @jrieken 
    - [x] Release notes
    - Enable that users can configure RETURN to not be a completion character.
- UI
  - [x] Guide the user for how to bring the hidden menu bar back #3421 @bpasero
  - [x] Toggle render whitespace shortcut/discoverability @isidorn 
  - [x] Allow to save UTF 8 with BOM Microsoft/vscode#751 @bpasero
    - Test: #3924
    - [x] Release notes
  - [x] Polish Indentation story #3590 @isidorn, @alexandrudima 
    - Test: #3922 
    - [x] Release notes
- Tasks
  - [x] Improve task configuration/creation #3849 @dbaeumer
  - test: #3159, #4019
  - [x] Release notes
- TypeScript/JavaScript
  - [x] Expose TS formatter options as user settings #3721 @dbaeumer 
    - Test: #4022 
    - [x] Release notes
  - [x] Expose the HTML formatter options as user settings #4013 @aeschli
    - Test: #4066
    - [x] Release notes
- Install/update
  - [x] Help users to not forget to read the release notes #3525 @joaomoreno
    - Show an info message with a command to open the release notes after an update restart
    - Test: #4023 
- Debug
  - [x] Show StoppedEvent.text in the UI Microsoft/vscode#3101 @isidorn
  - [x] Watermark, hint when watch pane is empty @isidorn
  - [x] Improving transition from debug to editing #3829 @isidorn 
#### Adoptions
- [x] TypeScript 1.8.9 when it becomes available (1.8.5 is available now)
- ~~Electron~~
#### Release
- [x] GA licenses @chrisdias 
- [x] Accessibility document @gregvanl

data.title: Get selected file/folder in the explorer view

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: It would be nice if it was possible to retrieve the selected file/folder in the explorer view. The use case where I want to use it for is my `vscode-yo` extension to be able to run the generator in the selected directory. An API for this would be nice.

data.title: Snippet Converted Not Working for literal Dollar Sign in Sublime Snippets
data.body:
_From @digitaldrummerj on February 22, 2016 4:55_

In sublime snippets, if you want to have a literal $ show up as part of the text the snippet inserts, you have to escape it with a backslash.  When the snippet conversion runs as part of yeoman extension generator, it changes the \$ that to a \$ so when you use the snippet in VSCode, you get a \$ inserted into your code of just the $.
### Sublime Snippet

```
<snippet>
  <content><![CDATA[
\$scope.\$broadcast('scroll.infiniteScrollComplete');
]]></content>
  <!-- Optional: Set a tabTrigger to define how to trigger the snippet -->
  <tabTrigger>ionicbroadcastinfinitescroll</tabTrigger>
  <!-- Optional: Set a scope to limit where the snippet will trigger -->
  <scope>source.js</scope>
</snippet>
```
### VS Code Converted Snippet

```
"ionicbroadcastinfinitescroll": {
        "prefix": "ionicbroadcastinfinitescroll",
        "body": "\n\\$scope.\\$broadcast('scroll.infiniteScrollComplete');\n",
        "description": "",
        "scope": "source.js"
    }
```
### When Used in VS Code (Notice the \$ instead of just $

```
\$scope.\$broadcast('scroll.infiniteScrollComplete');
```

_Copied from original issue: Microsoft/vscode-generator-code#32_

data.title: Mac OS X :: 0.10.9 :: Regular Expression Replace / Substitution
data.body: I'm trying to perform a very basic regex substitution in VS Code 0.10.9 on Mac OS X. However, it only substitutes `$0` with the string literal `$0`. How can I substitute captures in the regex replacement string? I can't find any documentation about this. Cheers, Trevor Sullivan Microsoft MVP: PowerShell

data.title: setFunctionBreakpoints request is coming in after launch request

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: I seem to be getting setFunctionBreakpoints requests after the launch request whereas setBreakpoints requests come in before the launch request.  Should I be using the configurationDone request or something here?  BTW the extension is configured to send the initialized event in the processing of the initialize request but before the initialize response is sent. Could that be causing this?

data.title: setFunctionBreakpoints not mentioned in protocol docs on InitializedEvent
data.body:
Shouldn't setFunctionBreakpoints be in this list:

``` javascript
    /** Event message for "initialized" event type.
        This event indicates that the debug adapter is ready to accept configuration requests (e.g. SetBreakpointsRequest, SetExceptionBreakpointsRequest).
        A debug adapter is expected to send this event when it is ready to accept configuration requests.
        The sequence of events/requests is as follows:
        - adapters sends InitializedEvent (at any time)
        - frontend sends zero or more SetBreakpointsRequest
        - frontend sends one SetExceptionBreakpointsRequest (in the future 'zero or one')
        - frontend sends other configuration requests that are added in the future
        - frontend sends one ConfigurationDoneRequest
    */
    export interface InitializedEvent extends Event {
    }
```

data.title: Re-implement "open derived source" feature
data.body:
Hi team,

In the early days of VSCode, there was a feature that I adored that allowed me to open the compiled output of my TypeScript files. By simply right clicking the source `.ts` file and clicking `Open derived output` I could view my `.js` output.

This feature was pulled due to not being able to find the compiled output if it was in a different directory.
There are many workarounds for this, but none as effective as this feature. I would love to see this re-added.

Thanks

data.title: Do not hide interaction prompt when window loses focus.
data.body: When install an extension, it takes quite a long time to load the list for me. But the only thing I can do is staring at the progress bar and waiting. Once I switch to another window, the prompt disappears, and I will have to wait again.

data.body: I am writing a debugger adapter, and sometimes i met a strange exception error like this: I don't know what's the error and how to trigger it. This error exists even i restarted VSCode. I have to restart my computer to fix the error. My environment: - VSCode: 0.19.0 - MAC OS X: 10.11.2

data.title: Add option to open preview in new editor from icon
data.body:
Most of the time when you're working in markdown (and probably SVG if the preview gets added to that view) you probably want to be able to see the source and the rendered result side by side. Currently you have to do a two step process of opening a new editor then pressing the preview toolbar button. There is also a (not so discoverable keyboard shortcut…which I couldn't get to work until I realised I had to let go of command-k first before pressing v)

Would be nice if you could do something like right click the preview icon and select open in new editor from a drop down or some such..

data.title: Register code as an editor in Debian with update-alternatives
data.body:
See https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-docs/issues/194

https://www.debian-administration.org/article/91/Using_the_Debian_alternatives_system

This will be a matter of adding some lines to `postinst` and `prerm`in the Debian package to register and deregister using `update-alternatives`.

data.title: Add updated extensions notification to status bar
data.body:
We've had a few requests for a notification system for updated extensions. I think we have an indication in the status bar if an extension fails to load, perhaps we can overload this and also show when new versions of extensions are available.

This would be a short term solution until we look at a richer in-product experience for discovering and managing extensions.

data.title: reactNamespace makes tsconfig.json invalid for VSCode
data.body:
Version of VSCode: 0.10.8 In workspace I have 2 files `tsconfig.json` and `app.tsx` and `npm install bobril` (it does not matter what module it is, it only should not be React) I have this in `tsconfig.json`: ``` { "compilerOptions": { "target": "es6", "module": "commonjs", "moduleResolution": "node", "jsx": "react", "reactNamespace": "b" }, "compileOnSave": false, "files": [ "app.tsx" ] } ``` Next I have this in `app.tsx`: ``` import * as b from "bobril"; b.init(()=>

Header

Lorem upsum

); ``` tsc.exe 1.8.2 successfully compiles it. But Vscode shows error in `app.tsx` on import "Cannot compile modules unless the '--module' ..." this error goes away if I remove `"reactNamespace": "b"` from `tsconfig.json` and it shows correct error on `
` that React is undefined. Only workaround I found is to remove that custom namespace and add line `const React = b;` to `app.tsx`.

data.title: Per-Syntax settings

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
**TL;DR:** Add settings support for per-syntax or improve the Markdown syntax settings recognition.

**Problems:**
In my project development, I usually works across different file types. Each of them is work a bit different than the another.

Let say I have a `.js` (JavaScript) file and some `.md` (Markdown) file. When I works with `.js` file, I want to trim of the whitespace at the end of each line while when I works with `.md` file, I want the VSCode to keep the whitespace at the end of line as-is () since the markdown syntax use double-spaces at the end of line to indicate line break. When I enabled `files.trimTrailingWhitespace`, I cannot save the file without remove these trailing whitespace on `.md` file and that is annoying to me.

Also, this is just a simple usage example of this feature. There are many cases that this feature would solve them easily.

**Possible Solutions:**
- Implement per-syntax settings so each file type can be configured differently (preferred).
- Implement the "smart settings" where if you works with (let says) Markdown file and there are double-spaces at the end of line (or just any language feature at similar to this) with `files.trimTrailingWhitespace` turn on, VSCode will not trim those lines.
